org.lenskit.util.keys

Class HashKeyIndex

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lenskit.util.keys.HashKeyIndex
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, KeyIndex

    public final class HashKeyIndex
extends Object
implements KeyIndex, Serializable

    Mutable index mapping backed by a hash table. This mapping allows indexes to be obtained before all keys have been seen, making it very useful for incremental processing.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Constructor and Description
      HashKeyIndex()
      Construct a new empty indexer.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HashKeyIndex

        public HashKeyIndex()

        Construct a new empty indexer. The first interned ID will have index 0.

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static HashKeyIndex create()

      • create

        public static HashKeyIndex create(LongList keys)

        Construct a new indexer. It maps each long key to its position in the list, and then be ready for more keys.

        Parameters:
        keys - The list of keys to store.

      • createFrozen

        public static FrozenHashKeyIndex createFrozen(LongList keys)

        Convenience method to create a frozen key index.

        Parameters:
        keys - The keys.
        Returns:
        A frozen index.
        See Also:
        FrozenHashKeyIndex.create(LongList)

        Description copied from interface: KeyIndex

      • getKeyList

        public LongList getKeyList()
        Description copied from interface: KeyIndex

        Get the list of indexed keys. This list is 0-indexed, so the key at position 0 in this list is at index KeyIndex.getLowerBound() in the key index.

        Specified by:
        getKeyList in interface KeyIndex
        Returns:
        The list of keys in the index. No key will appear twice.

      • tryGetIndex

        public int tryGetIndex(long id)
        Description copied from interface: KeyIndex

        Try to get the index for an ID, returning a negative value if it does not exist. This method is like KeyIndex.getIndex(long), except it returns a negative value instead of throwing an exception if the id does not exist.

        Specified by:
        tryGetIndex in interface KeyIndex
        Parameters:
        id - The ID to look for.
        Returns:
        The index of the ID, or a negative value if it is not in the index.

        Description copied from interface: KeyIndex

        Get the size of this index.

        Specified by:
        size in interface KeyIndex
        Returns:
        The number of indexed keys.

      • internId

        public int internId(long key)

        Get an index for a key, generating a new one if necessary.

        Parameters:
        key - The key.
        Returns:
        The index for key. If the key has already been added to the index, the old index is returned; otherwise, a new index is generated and returned.

      • frozenCopy

        public FrozenHashKeyIndex frozenCopy()

        Make an immutable copy of this index mapping.

        Specified by:

        Returns:
        An immutable copy of the index mapping.
